website_summaries.verdict: Flat seams work well for slow-pitch players. Leather cover is easy to grip.
pros: Leather cover gives this ball a high-quality feel
ASA-approved softball works for all league and tournament play
Poly center allows you to use this ball for a long time
cons: Cost per ball is higher than average

customer_reviews.title: Hot soft core balls! Very responsive off the bat!
customer_reviews.text: We're finishing the first season with these balls and I've been so pleased! Our league has a 4 homers/game rule and out of 7 games we've gone over the limit 3 times. These balls are extremely responsive even though they comply with the new standards of ASA. There's not any wondering when we get into a ball. I won't name our precious brand but it felt like we were hitting with foam nerf balls. I'll try to remember to update through the summer and fall to let y'all know endurance wise how they hold up. 7 games in and besides losing a few to a treeline some 370ft away the balls we have are in like new condition.
customer_reviews.author: Tharizz0

customer_reviews.title: Durable, quality ball
customer_reviews.text: ASA some years back switched to the 52 .cor 300lb compression. Dudley makes the most durable and quality ball. The leather cover provides a better grip and feel and protects against ball wear and tear during a game or practice. I play in a league that requires managers to provide game balls and other managers tend to go cheap and buy non Dudley with composite covers and the performance is simply not the same. These balls have never disappointed. Seller quick to send.
customer_reviews.author: The Great One

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are the same softballs our mens league uses. I bought them for our team to use at practice. They have held up great and have great pop!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Whitfield

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Having fun during the stay at home orders. They are bright and easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty lover

customer_reviews.title: Best ASA 52/300 on the market
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the best 52s on the market. Definitely worth buying the real leather rather than the slippery synthetic or fake-feeling composite softballs. My first dozen are still in great shape, even after 20+ BP team sessions; no warping and some scuffing (when we hit them out of the park onto pavement). Purchased 3 dozen so far and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Balls arrived on time and our league proceeded to whack the daylights out of them, but they hold up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Balls hit ok due to the softer core, the ...
customer_reviews.text: Balls hit ok due to the softer core, the covers don't take long to show wear and tear, lots of little nicks after one game, leather covers not very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Robert155

customer_reviews.title: Delivered 2 days sooner than expected. Bought for a ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered 2 days sooner than expected. Bought for a softball league I'm helping to run. Been using this ball for years, never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: jane mckessy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Used these as an official tournament ball and they were great!!! I will buy these again for my tournaments.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Great balls! Durable and have lasted two seasons so far plus a ton of practices.
customer_reviews.author: Amber0187

customer_reviews.title: but they are horrible now. The leather was getting ripped up after ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what happened to these balls, but they are horrible now. The leather was getting ripped up after only one game. Stay Away
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for league play, seem to cut, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for league play, seem to cut, tear, or deform one every game. Not as hot as other balls either. Will not repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dirks

customer_reviews.title: Best balls we've used
customer_reviews.text: These balls really fly. They last for multiple games and don't deform no matter how hard you hit them.
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Great ball! These things are very lively off the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great ball! These things are very lively off the bat.
customer_reviews.author: AUSTX Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Good Ball
customer_reviews.text: Meh, ASA keeps drumming down the ball. These are good throw in balls after a home run is hit. The leather outer lasts longer and seems to hit harder. We start with a synthetic covering that is only good for 3 innings max. Hit a home run early and throw one of these in the game if you have to provide the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: StevieT

customer_reviews.title: Nice balls
customer_reviews.text: The balls are of good quality and have a nice sound coming off the bat. They feel good in the hand. :-))
customer_reviews.author: Robert York

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product which holds up well against the elements. Played multiple games with no broken stitching, torn coverings or warped sides. Would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Chong

product_meta.title: Dudley ASA Thunder Hycon Leather Slowpitch Softball - 12 Pack, 4A065YA, Yellow
product_meta.description: Feel the weight, study the grip, and play like a pro with the ASA Thunder Hycon Slowpitch Softball. Technologically advanced for superior play, this is the ball for your slowpitch game.
feature_bullets: Steady compression in both high and low temperatures
Lower compression design results in less damage to bats
Leather cover provides improved grip and protection
